Package com.mssrchapelier.TigreParser.components.utils.word

Contains the internal representations of word objects and their components used throughout the application.

A WordEntry object couples an input word (a String either specified by the user or an element of the array returned by Tokeniser.tokenise) with an ArrayList of WordAnalysis instances, each of which represents a single analysis of the input word. An analysis is construed to consist of two lines, the surface line (the transliterated version of the input word; see Transliterator) and the gloss line, each segmented into the word's constituent morphemes. WordAnalysis implements separation of the word not into the surface and gloss parts, but first into the morphemes, which are represented by an ArrayList of AnalysisSegment objects. AnalysisSegment is an abstract class representing a single segment of the word's two-line (surface and gloss) analysis; this class has as its subclasses MorphemeAnalysis, the representation of a morpheme that has been detected by the PatternProcessor's or VerbProcessor's processWord method (which has both a surface form and a gloss associated with it), and UnanalysedMorpheme, which represents the unanalysed part of the input word (and only has a surface form associated, but no gloss).

The package also contains the class WordAnalysisComparator, which is used to sort a collection of WordAnalysis objects when instantiating WordEntry, so that analyses deemed to be more complete (see the compare method of the class) will appear in the beginning of the collection (when reverse ordering is applied; i. e. the more complete an analysis, the greater).

This package is intended for internal use only.
